page.title: 13AGRICULTURE, WYKE AREA
page.content: Most of the agriculture carried out in this area is that of dairy farming. The most common cattle are Friesian The females are taken from their mothers after birth and are fed artificially, they will be kept for the dairy herd. The males are taken for fattening into beef. Most of the fields are manured for Summer grazing. The main crops grown are for feed for the cattle. A lot of the grass is grown to be cut for silage for winter feed. Several small stables are to be found in the area which are used by local people for recreational purposes. On smaller farms and small-holdings, some crops are grown for the markets of Leeds, Bradford, Halifax and Huddersfield.
